text: Hodně dobré černé pivo, které svou suí chutí dává pivu zajímavou originalitu. Jemná pěna, silnějí aroma, chuť řízná, hořčejí.
Pitch black body with minimal sized brown head. Slightly roasty aroma with licorice and sweetness. Some chocolate, caramel and roasted malt taste. Watery, soft to flat carbonation.

Bottle. Dark brown/black lager. Very Malty; very roast or burnt malts, smoky, bitter dark chocolate, espresso coffee, nuts. Hoppy; grassy hops. Bittersweet with a bitter roast edge throughout. Long dry "smoky" roast malty finish. Very nice! Lovely Beer! (2009-01)

Bottle as a gift. BB 26.07.2017. Pours dark brown, head brief. Subtle roasty-toasty coffee aroma; roasty flavour, coffee, leafy-earthy bitterness. Fine active carbonation, medium body, dry finish. Very nice although I wouldnt want another. Its quite intense in a way.

Flaske via DjOeye. Aroma røsted malt, karamell, frukt. Utseende mørk brun, nesten svart med lys beige skum, den skummet sakte over etter åpning. Smak røsted malt, tørr kaffe, mørk sjokolade, noe bittersøt i avslutningen. Den er litt mye carbonert. Ellers en god øl
tap @ öszvér (budapest) dark colour, medium body, semi carbonated, roasted malty, dark choholate

Aroma; dark malt, roasted malt, grass, almonds n prunes.
Look; fawn head, very dark brown body.
Taste; dark roasted malts, prune, roast coffee, almond, nut - leading to a dry finish.
Feel; dry. 
Overall; not bad .
[50cl btl 5.2% bb.12.01.17 t@Øvre Breivang]

Thanks Sina! From the Mali Dućan Matejuka in Split. Dark brown body. Aromas of caramel and dark malts mainly. Caramel and the "dark maltiness" continues on into the taste, quite fine and actually complex, with no real hop presence. Sweetish, slightly fruity, slightly soapy. Soft and quite nice - definitely a very good dark lager!
33cl bottle.Pitch black with really soft mouthfeel. Roasted malts, dark fruits, some smoke and oak. Nice bitter finish.

Medium carbonation and small creamy brown head with lacing. Smell is potently sweet with caramel and smokey roast. Taste is sweet and malty. Strong taste of caramel and toffee with a cedar-y coffee finish. Vanilla is definitely present. Red berries balance out the roasted notes with sweetness. Sweet, Malty and full of caramel and toffee hints. Its great!
Dough yeast aroma, this has some dark fruits and cola malt in the flavour, but is quite drinkable. Bargain beer from lidl .
Bottle from lidl rochdale, dark with ruby halo, great tan head and lacing, taste fudge chocolate bahaves a lot like decent mild smooth and easy drinking.
Bottle at 5.7%. Medium tan head. Chestnut body. Cherry, oak, smoke. Bittersweet with some sourness. Dry finish.

Bottle at home, 06/07/16. Bought at Lidl with a label not currently on here: Czech Black Lager. The bottle also mentions 1506 a few times which does not appear to be on the picture here. Picked up an aroma as soon as I started pouring. Dough, roasted coffee, a hint of herbs. As expected - its dark, with a more translucent cola look as the glass gets narrower. Good frothy off-white head. Extremely smooth, with an oily residue. Sweet, followed by bitterness. Not particularly carbonated. I like. Too many could become a bit sickly.
hvala prijatelju goranu na ovom pivu ..stvarno dosta dobro crno pivo ..izuzetno pitko ...bez gorcine ...karamelast okus ..fino ohladjeno je bas za uzivanje..
Black body and a small tan head. Malty aroma, dark bread, licorice. Clean taste, slightly bitter finish. Smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
500ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a medium-sized beige head that lasts. Aroma is milk chocolate, roastiness, coffee. Taste is light sweet, strong coffee, brown sugar.
Bottle from Lidl. Crisp black colour with a thick tan head. Aroma is light roasted malt, taste has more fruit and roasted malt. nice rich body.

0.5 l bottle at Pivovarsky klub, Prague. Dark brown to black with reddish tint, small tan head. Caramel and dark malts, quite dry in the beginning, roasted malts heavily present. Soft carbonation, medium body. Lingering aftertaste, milky structure. Quite good.
Picked up the bottle at Lidl, label says Czech Black Lager. Good deal for a pretty solid beer.
Bottle from Lidl, Sowerby Bridge. Deep clear red with a very thin head. Quite mild in its character, with a small richness in its sweetness, some smooth tasting dark malts and a hint of liquorice.

500ml Bottle from Lidl, Langley Moor, Durham. 

A beer that looks like a coke, very dark brown with almost no head and a fair amount of carbonation. The aroma is quite appealing and has some dark malt, pepper and noble hop elements to it. This is a beer that does well in balancing its dark character with the fact its obviously a lager. Theres plenty of cocoa and light smoke, as well as crisp, light, clean noble hop flavours. Not the kind of beer I really go for but pretty decent.

Wow, really surprised how good this was for a £1.20 bottle from Lidl.Pours jet black with a tan head. Smells of molasses and liquorice, very pleasant.Taste is sweet caramel and malt, nice and rich treacle.Amazing for the price.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Look: dark red, almost black, not fully opaque, clear, with dark head.

Aroma: roasted, sweet robusta.
Taste: almost dry with light sweetnness and light hoppy bitternes.
Flavour: roasted and burned, sweet coffee, some spicy and grassy hops.

Good.

A surprising and very pleasing bargain from Lidl, something from whch I really wasnt expecting very much at all. From bottle it pours a dark dark brown/red with tan head which lingers. Aroma reminds me of Guinness original but with a bit more going on, toasted malt certainly present along with some dark fruit, dark chocolate and coffee along with a slight over all presence of decent lager. Taste is smooth mild sweet, slightly sticky but nicely roasted bitter on the finish. Overall a really decent buy, I must head back and get some more in!
Bottle at home. Pours black with a thin head. Aroma of chocolate, malts and a little coffee. Taste is coffee, bread, a little coffee on the finish. Nice smooth feel to it. Decent
Igazi vizes testű halovány árnyék! A legjobb grandmas beans mellé fogyasztva!

Nice beige head, with small bubbles. Smells like roasted malt/chicory coffee, some hoppy notes. Black, clear, but quite fizzy, what does not help at all. Deep dark coffee taste, with a note of deeply roasted coffee seeds. Leaves a sourly, bitter aftertaste. Lively carbonation, medium to full bodied, quite oily. To much bubbles to get a top score, but really impressive!

Aroma: some coffee and a little chocolate; there?s some bluntness to the aroma that I can?t quite isolate or name. Appearance: black; opaque; head medium, fine, stable. Taste: a little more bitter than sweet, slightly sour. Palate: body nearing full; carbonation average; mouth feel spicy; finish faint, bittersweet. Overall: feels portery to some degree. This would explain the high rating because much as this beer is fairly decent and almost enjoyable, I can frankly see no other rationale for it than the strange obsession ratebeer users seem to have with anything that smells remotely of coffee or chocolate.

Bottle 0,5 liter, Pours dark, almost black with a big tanned head, hints of coffee and red wine on the nose, palate is chocolate, then dry and burnt-bitter with a light umami note and a little coffee in the burnt-bitter finish. nice lager!

Bottle. Lidl. Clear, deep red. Thin, bubbly, sticky, tan head. Nose of chocolate malts. Dark fruit. Nutty milk chocolate. Hint of coffee. Hint of liquorice as it warms. Taste has a soft, brown sugar sweetness first off. Turns roasty dry and light bitter. Smooth mouthfeel. Nicely rounded. Fruity dry finish. I need to get back down to Lidl...
Bottle 0.33l from local Alko, Vantaa. BBE 15.09.16. Colour is black with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Some coffee, some chocolate and roasted malts. Not bad.
0,5l bottle,deep red in colour with a sweet caramelly nose,flavor is moderately sweet,lightly bitter,light soft body.

500ml bottle from Lidl - Near black body with a lasting beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, hints of caramel and dark fruits. Taste is roasted malt with some liquorice, coffee and nuts; finish is mostly dry. Dont have many dunkels or tmavý these days, but this on is a corker...

500ml bottle from Lidl, Darlington. Black colour, beige foam head leaving some spotty lacing and aroma of roast malt, chocolate & coffee. Taste is roasted dark malts, sweetish, molasses, with powdered chocolate, coffee, liquorice, some bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft to medium carbonation, dry earthy finish. Quite drinkable.
500ml bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, caramel, bready, chocolate, licorice, coffee. Sweet and bitter taste. Light to medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.
Very dark brown with thin head. Aroma has some toasted dark malts leaning towards coffee. Flavour is bittersweet with dark, roasted malts dominating.
Black color with mininal head. Roasted malts, chocolate. Sweet and burned taste with bitter end. Excellent for its price value.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 15.09.16, 20151030) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and nearly white. Aroma had chocolate, roasted malts and molasses. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were burnt mals, molasses, sweetness, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste was malty and bitter. A nice sweet schwarzbier. Too burnt for a dunkel.

Bottle from Lidl, near-black with a tan crema, hints of coffee and red wine on the nose, palate is chocolate, then dry and burnt-bitter with a light umami note and a little coffee in the burnt-bitter finish. Like a cross between Schwarzbier and a dry stout.

33 cl, bottled. BB 15.09.16. Pours black with a decent tanned head. Aroma: Roasted malt, mämmi. Old potatoes. Taste: Medium sweet, pleasant mämmi flavour. Palate: Medium body, semi-dry finish. Pleasant balanced dark lager. Enjoyable.

500 ml bottle, cheapie from Lidl, served cold in a tulip. Black with a smooth tan head. Aroma of chocolate and rust. Bitter chocolate flavour, almost to the point of citric, but managing to pull of a creamy mouthfeel at the same time. Very tasty, and extremely good value

500ml bottle from 1420, León. @home 15-10-2015.
BBD: 16-09-2015.
In short: tasty dunkel.
Pours quite dark wih nice light tan head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Roasty, caramel, licorice, dark fruits nose. Medium body, average carbonation, little crispy texture. Taste is some malty, caramel, with nice roasty bitter finish, some dry. Very solid brew, quite enjoyable.

Fľaa 500 ml z pivotéky v Nitre. Tmavá načervenalá priehľadná farba, pena hustá vysoká, jemná aróma praeného karamelu. Rezkosť niia, nasládlá chuť, slad, karamel, káva. V zloení cukor aj kyselina askorbová, ale chuťovo celkom ok.
Very dark brown with thick foamy beige head. Chocolate malts aroma. Slight ting on tongue and in mouth. Chocolate, Smokey and creamy finish. Ok beer.

Bottle. Nose is licorice, coffee, roasted malts. Very appealing. Taste is roast, coffee, licorice, some soy. Mouthfeel Id a little thin.

I always find this very enjoyable.
Ciemno brazowa dlugo utrzymujaca sie piana . Bardzo ciemny kolor . Nagazowanie srednie. Wyrazne tony przypalonego chmielu, karmelu, lekko chlebowy posmak. Ciekawe piwo.
Draught. Almost pitch black with a fading beige head. Aroma of liquorice, coffee, smokey. Taste is of dark chocolate, coffee, liquorice, long metallic finish. Soft carbonation, slick oily mouthfeel.
Schöne dunkelbraune Farbe, kräftiger Geruch nach Malz, leicht süßlich, Kaffee Aromen, malzig leicht süß

Bottle shared at the Tropical Croydonia tasting. 01/07/2015. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. Aroma is nutty sweet roast, ocffee bean, wearthy notes. Cola coloured pour. Flavour is composed of sweet stale malts, jam, earthy roast. Palate is thin, moderate carbonation. Pretty boring.

Aroma: Light toasty, light roasty, sweet coffee, licorice.
Appearance: Brilliant, dark brown body with red highlights. Medium, light-brown head. Good retention.
Flavour: Medium Munich malt, light licorice. Light bitterness, well balanced. Dry finish with lingering munich/licorice.
Mouthfeel: Medium body. Medium-high carbonation, creamy.
Overall: Very nice!

500 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
4B. Munich Dunkel
Bottle. Pours a black colour with a beige head, malty aroma, taste is roasted malt with a hint of coffee with a thin finish.
pours black in colour, roasted malts, some toffee, creamy aftertaste, bought from lidl, very nice
Pours a black colour. Taste is liqorice like with some cereal and malt. A very nice beer

Bottle split at Scopesters on melt day, thanks to Daniel, 01/07/15. 
Mahogany brown topped with a decent beige swirl.
Nose is biscuit, wood, toffee, light charr.
Taste comprises sweet and sour notes, dark fruit peel, malt.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close.
Ok.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Lidl on Acre Lane. Pours beautifully into the glass with a lovely large foam off white head. Opaque very dark brown to black.Nose isnt that great. Metallic, little roasted coffee, roasted malt, light grass, brown bread, slight lactic. Not easy to pick out the aroma. Taste is lactic milky, slight roasted malt, milk chocolate, light dried grass. On the finish theres some subtle roasted dry malt and some lactic sweetness. Good for a supermarket beer, but not pushing far beyond that.

BOTTLE 50CL. Black with faint red highlights, frothy dark beige head. Aroma of malt with light roast notes. The taste is slightly sweet and roasted with a distinct spicy bitter finish. Generally, this dark lager is on the dry side. Not mind blowing, but pretty solid.

Bottle at the tropical Croydonia tasting. It pours darkest brown with a small beige head. The nose is toasty, bready, bitter-sweet, berry, candy, light jam and rocky road. The taste is toasty, bitter, malt-driven, earthy roast, roasted malt, caramel/toffee and some dried fruits with a short, dry finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Simple, yet well-rounded and rather drinkable. Decent.

Bottle share in Croydon. BB July 2016, 5.2%. Picked up at Lidl, and shared as a crappy extra. Cola brown, slight haze, small foamy tan head. Aroma is earthy, papery. Body is medium to light, a little foamy, soft carbonation. Taste is light, thin bready toffee-ish malts, light ash and roast, soft bitterness. OK, just a little plain.
Bottle.almost black colour with medium beige head.Aroma is roasted and with taste of roasted malt and coffee,nice and well balanced with,nice well balanced mouth feels and smooth finish.

Bottle from lidl, walsall. Very dark brown beer with reddish tints and a tight medium tan head. Aroma of light toffee, brown bread and some cocoa. Taste is dark malts, some bread, toffee, dark fruits, chocolate and ash. Creamy on the palate. I enjoyed this one, very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Daniel. Pours clear brown with a creamy tan head. The aroma holds burnt toast, some cocoa, earth. Light to medium sweet flavor with toasted cereal, slight toffee, cocoa, dried berries. Light bodied with average carbonation. Finishes with some toasted sugars, bread, faint cocoa, cereal. Simple but tasty.
Bottle @ Croydonia. Deep brown with a small head. Pretty malty. Coffee and cocoa. Earth. Brown bread.taste is similar. Malty sweetness. A bit of leafy bitterness. Simple stuff. Not bad, bro.

Bottle from Jill bought in Lidl. Deep brown with a fading off white head. Not much aroma. Roast malt initially with some coffee. Some slight metallic notes too. Light in body and semi refreshing. Not bad.
Skaniai atrodo, putele tirstolka ir laikosi. Skonis lengvas, kartokas, kartumas laikosi ilgai. Kiek gerenis nei vidutiniskas alus.

Poured from the bottle into a tall glass to drink. The beer had a cloudy brown-dark amber color with a slightly lighter amber hue and a good-sized foamy tan head with average retention, lighter cling and lacing. The aroma featured a blend of malty notes with chocolate, caramel, toffee, and a bit of earthy and grainy hops too. It was somewhat sweet with light notes of chocolate and toffee, but also had a grainy bitter effect. The body had average carbonation and thickness with a slight creamy feel and was a touch dry.
Sep 11, 2007 On tap at Pivovarsky Klub. Delicious. Dark beer with a tall head. Chocolate taste and quite sweet. Very hoppy and creamy. Could drink these all night.
Black, medium white head. Lovely roasty-chocolatey aroma. Medium to light body, not too sweet, not too bitter, yet very flavourful at 5,2 ABV. Finishes roasty. Very good.
Pours pure dark with medium brownish head. Smell is gentle and slightly yeasty. The taste can not be described well. Ot is simply put: perfect.

bottle at home from trade with Jamedra, thanks Roman. black color, medium big tan head. smells malty, roasted, some bitter chocolate, milky / creamy aroma, like subtle smoke notes, smells quite good. medium body, slick mouthfeel, medium carbonation, roasted taste, malty, light vegetables / a bit medical, some coffee, dry / roasted bitter finish. quite good. quite complex for the low ABV.
bottle 0,5L...black color...interesting aroma... chocolate, coffee...great taste...Its probably the best black lager

Bottle. Black colour, head does not stay long, no lacing. Aroma is slightly roasty, some licorice. Light bitterness, light sweetness. Medium body, soft carbonation. Not bad, but for me its boring - lacks bitterness and roastiness. There are better Czech beers of this kind.

Bottle 0,50L. Clear, very dark brown colour with average big, long lasting, creamy, light brown head. Aroma of hazelnuts, caramel, biscuits, milk chocolate. Taste starts light sweet with chocolate milk and hazelnuts napolitano cakes flavor, while the finish is light bitter with dark chocolate touch. Medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very good dunkel.
Bottle, shared by friend.  Dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, caramel. Taste, roasted malt, coffee, caramel. Not so sweet as other Czech Dunkels, good.

Deep dark brown color with a tan head that keep a lacing for a while. Aroma is roasty and hoppy, hints of coffee and chocolate. Flavor is like aroma but quite balanced sweet and bitterness. Medium body with a low carbonation and a sweet bitter end.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dark brown with a large tan head. Aroma is sweet roasted malt, milk chocolate and caramel. Taste is sweet with chocolate notes, some caramel and a light roasted bitterness. Smooth medium body.
Flaska från @JanVah, Tack! Nästa svart vätska med ljusbrunt skum som lägger sig fort. Doftar lingonsylt och choklad. Smakar välrostad malt med en aning kaffe och lakrits. Riktigt god!

Bottle. Licorice, bread crust, toasted grain and cocoa milk in the aroma. Quite chocolatey flavour, with roasted notes giving way to coffee in the finish, accompanied by shy milky and licorice notes. Greatly balanced, dryish, devoid of the sweetness that so often ruins a promising Czech dunkel. A great effort.

Bottle
Aroma-roasty, caramel, 
Appearance-black, cloudy, brown foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, lively, bitter finish
Overall-perfrct
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein rötlichbraunes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Karamell, leicht würzig. Geschmack leicht röstmalzig, leicht würzig, Karamell, leicht schokoladig.

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Dancing Camel Pub, Florentine. Coke-like dark brown with tan film. Malt, dark sultanas and dried fig aroma, sweet medicinal, and a little dry bitterness. Light body, slightly burnt sweet and a little caramel finish. Quite alright.

At a tasting, thanks kerenmk, clear darkish brown colouer with reddish hues, light roasty aroma with some dark bread and earthy notes, dark sour bread flavour, with some sweet malt. Bland and uninteresting.
Mörkbrun, nästan svart lager med mörkt slum. Doft och smak av kaffe och choklad. Lite sötma som rundar av smaken.

Aroma: roasted dark malts.
Appearance: nice black color and beige lasting head.
Taste: iron, roasted dark malts, dry.
Palate: medium body, hih carbonation, unpleasent iron aftertaste.
Overall: not bad schwarzbier with one serious disadvantage.
Sample at a tasting. Dark body with a low head. Roasted malt and loads of weird sweet notes. Not my "cup of tea".

(Bottle 0,5l)
Dry, roasted malt, light sweet malty aroma. Opaque black color. All time light brown head. Medium sweet, light chocolate, light roasted malt flavor. Medium body. Sticky texture. Dry finish.

ive tasted it like Herold Tmave Specialni... it has caramel and fruity aroma with shades of coffee and toffee candy... light body with tones of caramel malt and dark fruits... aftertaste is dry and hoppy...

500ml bottle that I bought in Czech Rep.
Aroma has malts, hay, grains, some coffee and little caramel.
Pours darkbrown, no head, no sparkling, looked like a coke thats been open for too long.
Taste has raisins, gingerbread, herbs, licorice.
Weak watery mouthfeel.

In bottle .. not a bad beer but hoped for more given the reviews. Aroma was somewhat of molasses and tobacco. Taste was quite dry and sharp with tobacco notes ... OK, but not great .. not sure if I would buy again

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 Flaska från Systembolaget. Mörkt brunröd vätska med kraftigt mörkt skum. Doft av rostat kaffe, choklad, bränd karamell och lite röda bär. Sötma i smak som avklingar när den möter en snudd på perfekt balans av beska. Medellång eftersmak.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2013 Bottled , Pilsen , CZ , Malt,roasted,chocolate,coffee and caramel aroma , Dark brown color with bigger lacing head , Sweeter taste with long finish , Fuller body , Soft carbon , Superb Czech dunkel..
England: South Littleton. This is a great Dunkel with lots of character well worth seeking out.
50 cl. flaske. 5,2 %. Købt i Galerie Piva ved Karlsbroen i Prag. Dejlig mørkt, ja sort, øl. Godt til grillet mad

Láhev 500 ml. Sladové aroma s lehkým závanem kávy. Pěna je vysoká, tmaví krémově hnědá a jemná. Barva piva je černá lehce průsvitná kde se zbarvuje do tmavě ruda. Chuť piva je kvasnicová, sladová a lehká kávová hořkost jsou zde znát i náznaky jahod. Pivo je vcelku dobře pitelné a chuťově zajímavé.

500ml bottle from Alko in Hetta, Finland. Clear palisander body. Plum, prune, roasted chestnuts, with hint of cherry, bread, vanilla and licorice in both aroma and taste. Balanced and pleasant! (Shared 22,.Aug.2011)
Ett välbalanserat mörkt lageröl utan påträngande sötma. Smak och doft av nötter , mörk choklad med aning av röda bär och rostade toner.
Pint at the Czech Inn in Dublin.  looks pretty dark and not very opaque/wheatish. pretty sweet malt aroma. molasses and dark fruit. Usually really good but had several bad ones ...

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090217.
Pours dark red color with a small head. Aroma of malts, some dark fruits, caramel and some mild spice notes. Flavor of malts, hay, syrup and some caramel. Nice.
Deep black body with a lightly brown creamy head. Nose of strong malts, molasses, coffee. Moderately bitter, moderately sweet flavour. Well balanced, nice mouthfeel. Complete beer.
Bottle at Pivovarsky Klub. Pours dark brown with a ruby hue and a thick, off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt. Flavour is slightly metalic. Toffee. Dry, hoppy finish. Delicious.

Color is black with a bit brown to it with a nice cinnamon like  head that stays. Aroma is interesting it/s chocolate, coffee, toffee, lactose.. Taste is as great as the aroma it has everything that you expect from the aroma and a really smooth palate, something like sweet espresso maybe. This is probably the best black lager I had from a Czech brewery.

50cl Bottle at Volume10, Athens, Greece, as Tmave Specialni Pivo. Clear dark reddish brown to black colour, light beige head. Aroma of light roast, burnt caramel, toffee. Flavour is light roasted, chocolate, toffee, light roasted bitter coffee finish. Light bodied, light flavoured. OK dunkel/schwarz.

Bottle. Pours dark brown to black color with nice lasting white to brown head. Aroma is roast, coffee, hops, hint of chocolate. Flavor is coffee, cocoa powder. Bitterness seems to be coming more from coffee tones than from hops. Nice long roast aftertaste. Well balanced.

A - Almost black with a slight red tint on the bottom of the glass. The head is perfect tan and lasts well into the beer and leaves a decent lacing.

S - Burnt/roasted malts, dry fruits, chocolate, a whiff of an open field.

T - toasty, malty, cocoa powder, bit of coffee, and a little sweetness.

M&D - great carbonation, easy to drink, very quaffable (not sure if thats a word but you know what I mean). Nice body, could drink it all night.

Bottle as "Tmavé speciální pivo, Czach black lager". ABV 5.3%.
Very dark brown, near black with a thin beige head. Aroma of coffee and caramel. Dry taste of coffee and roasted malt.

(bottle, as "Herold Tmavé Speciální") Dark brown, brown head. Roasted, metallic/mineral aroma, pure licorice pastilles. Lightly bitter, with a dry finish. A good black lager. I am neither a fan of that style nor of the metallic aroma, but here it seems okay and fitting.

16th march 2008: Drinking round the world today, had a Malt lager from Kenya and an Ale from the UK so far. So a Black Lager from Bohemia (now the Czech Republic) isnt a bad third choice.

Brown 500ml bottle, loads of life left, well 8 months anyway.

Poured into one of my Thistle shaped Gordon glasses (twice).

Cracking look to it, really deep black/ruby red colour with a fantastic creamy, full, biege head on top. The thistle glass really shows it off well.

More aroma than most black beers Ive had, there is some burnt malts and more than a little Porter and Stout type smells too.

Again the burnt malts are the dominant factor, this time with a lager style sharpness added.

At 5.2% it sits nicely, there is a slight heaviness in the mouthfeel, but it isnt a thick beer by any means.

I think this is the best Black Beer (style wise) Ive ever had, not checked my other review scores but I dont remember enjoying one this much before. A very nice beer.
From old backlog. Deep dark brown colour with medium head. Aroma and flavour is roasted, sweet finish. Would like to test again.

Almost black pour with some ruby highlights in the thinner areas of the glass. Slim tan head that leaves a bit of lacing behind. A chocolatey, malty aroma with some slight hints of roasted grain. A nice malty flavor with hints of bread. A slight coppery taste in the backend. Smooth and creamy mouth. Not too bad.

Thick-set brown-tan head, rather stable over ultra-deep dark chestnut coloured beer. Aromatic nose with chocolate, dark malts, dry grains, parsley, cypress and pine ashes. More chocolate and more ashes in the taste; sweet and dry-bitterish, balanced in a sinusoidal way: very good! Feels well-carbonated, and probably better bodied than it really is; quite slick. Excellent dark, satisfying, pleasing and - oh God, Im using the m-word myself, definitely too long in CAMRA - more-ish.  Many thanks, Denisa and Honza!

barnyard, cooked vegetables, citrus, chocolate, bread, nuts, brown, cloudy, brown foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, umami, full body, creamy, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish, bitter,
Julkryddor, enbär och honung i smaken, som är mjuk och fruktig. Fint vitt skum till en mörkröd kropp.
Drafted at klub malych pivovaru in Pilsen,not a bad beer by any means , but nothing exceptional,toffee,burnt toast,battery acid,dark fruits,by far not the fourth best czech beer

At a tasting, thanks Troubles, pours red to black with a small beige head, aroma of milk chocolate, mint, cherries, roasted tones and some butter, flavor of dark bread, milk chocolate and malty acids, medium bodied, nice

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2014 Re-rate 2/14: Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks kerenmk. Roasty, coffee, caramel, a bit of nuts. Sweetish and slightly bitter. Nice stuff. 7/3/7/3/14=3.4

Black, medium beige head. Sweet dark malt aroma. Beautiful darkly roasted malt taste, quite burnt but not unpleasantly at all and not oily. Pleasantly hopped, but that takes a back seat to the maltiness. Some butteriness. Very well balanced, very drinkable.

Bottle at Bishop Arms, Järntorget, Göteborg, Sweden. Dark brown, medium beige head. Fruity, roasted aroma, slightly nutty, with faint hop notes. Medium bodied and smooth. Well balnced, with an initial sweetness, backed up by a firm bitterness. Very nice.

Nice dark brown color with reddish hues when held to the light, tan head lots of bubbles on side of glass. Head leaves quickly leaving behind a clean glass. Roast nut aroma maybe a hint of liquorice, and chocolate. More light bodied then expected, smooth watery feel,  a bit astringent, but malts are prevailent as well as some bitter chocolate. Semi-dry finish. Would be refreshing to have this on a hot day and switch to a porter at night.
Bought this one in England. Deeply dark beer, large and consistent head. Taste of roasted malts (4 different are used). Finishes with a taste reminiscent of coffee. Lovelly brew!

Prague-07. Pours deep black with faint beige head. Has roasty-licorice aroma, taste of roasty malts with a bit of sweetness and cocoa notes. Body is relatively light for a dark beer to make it quite easy-drinking.

Bottle at Wetherspoons, Sheperds Bush, 14-04-07. Pours very dark in colour, some wood, malt, and bitter cocoa in aroma. Tasted very pleasant with nice maltiness, and quite bitter at times, this was interesting to compare this with their other bottled beer that I tried this evening.

Bottled.  Poured a clear, deeper reddish-brown with a short-lived cap of spotty white head.  The aroma was quite sweet, rocking the roasty milk chocolate with some herbal and grassy notes .. quite pleasant.  Flavor was centered by sticky-sweet roasted milk chocolates too.. molasses and other dark sweetness surround the tongue.. tacky, sweet finish... drier, mild herbal bitterness.. some cereal maltage appears as it warms up.  About medium-bodied and a bit too sweet to drink a whole bunch.. solid all around.
deep black red in colour, with a roast malt nose, rich bitter roast a little creamy but quite bitter and drying

Rich malty aroma with some hoppiness.  Not as much malt flavor, but the hops really do bite on the backend.  This has all of the qualties of a good beer, and there is not much to turn you off.  Very well made.

A great beer on tap.  Pours very dark brown with hints of crimson when held to light.  Quite malty, fantastic flavor, one of the best schwarzbiers I have had.  Goes great with a burger.  I liked this one a lot.

Pretty disgusting in my view and cant understand the high ratings.  Very much like an Eastern European version of a porter with a sickly, heavy, sweet flavour, with rich tastes of chocolate.  Looks cool though with its black colouring and swanky bottle, so marked it up a bit higher than it really deserves!

A dark black coloured beer with reddish tints in the lght and a thickish, milky coffee coloured head. A rich malty nose, woody and chocolatey, with a hint of ripe fruit. The taste is dry, with a fizzy mouthfeel. A bitter, malty flavour, with a woody spice and dark chocolate taste. the finish is long and bitter. Made a surprisingly pleasant partner with our Chocolate Fudge Cake!!! (Bottle - The Globe JDW, Kings Lynn, Norfolk).

Ruby-black pour with a tan head that leaves soapy lace.  Milk chocolate and vinous notes to the nose.  Im picking up roasts initially upfront, but a sweeter back palate into the finish.  The roasted hop effervescence returns for the very end of the pull, and coupled with a creamy mouthfeel, not a bad offering.  The palate may be construed as thin, but Im picking up more of a "light" take on the style.

Dark, reddish brown body: slightly tan head, but its a small head - barely making it around the sides of the glass.  Strong molasses-filled aroma, malty and quite inviting.  The flavor is highly roasted, malts galoare.  Not very full-bodied, though.  Thin finish.  Slightly watery.

Bottle from Santa - dark brown with red tint - roasted malt, caramel and cocoa aroma - medium roasted malt character - light chocolate sweetness, but the beer is mostly dry, with a light peat quality - a hint of plum in the background - a decent schwarzbier, but nothing to rave about.
dark, redish brown with a heavy tan foam. Malty, roasted with chocolate tones. Medium body with bitter finish.

(07.12.06) One pint 0.9 oz brown bottle from DiCarlos, Mundelein, IL. 5.2% ABV Roasted malt raisin  aroma. Poured opaque black with tiny off-white head. No discernable carbonation. Medium bodied lager that starts dry with light roasted malt and dried prune flavors. Finished dry with light roasted malt fade. Very good drinkable lager.

Pours a three finger light brown head that fades slowly to a shallow layer leaving a good lace.  Black color.  Light carbonation and medium-heavy bodied. Caramel nose.  Starts malty with a sweet caramel flavor not cloying, finish has hints of hops. Nice black lager.  $2.49 for a 500ml bottle from Johns Grocery Iowa City, Ia.

Bottle.  Pours a stouty black with reddish tinges.  Pale tan head that disapates quickly into nice lacing.  Spicy, herbal (licorice and thai basil), roasty and malty nose, though somewhat subdued.  Taste is vibrant roasted malts and spice up-front that mellows rather quickly due to thinnish mouthfeel.  Pleasant lasting licorice and coffee finish with enough hop bitterness to request another mouthfull.  Overall a very pleasant beer.  Wish I were drinking it outside their 500-year old castle brewery!

Bottle. Pours black with a medium brownish head. Aromas are subtle, a hint of roasted malts and chocoate. Flavors are more pronounced, there is a roastiness, and hints of caramel and chocolate, in addition one can discern a bitter hops flavor lingering. Ok body, could be a bit more robust, but a good Schwarzbier.

From a 500 ml. euro bottle with a blurb on the back label with no freshness date.

Poured a dark cola brown with a foamy off-white/pale tan head that settled into a thin lacing, minimal amount of sticking.

Aromas of roasted malts and grain, dark fruits, nutty, and a bit floral.

Moderate carbonation overall and a malty crisp, dryish, velvety smooth medium bodied mouthfeel.

Tastes of roasted dark malts and burnt chocolate, plum fruity, tannic, nutty and herbal, a subtle bitter coffee towards the end and a nutty and sweet roasted malty finish.

Very enjoyable, worth trying.

500mL bottle.  Pours a dark black color with reddish tinge, translucent brown edges; big-bubble tannish head, retained around the edges.  Aroma shows plenty of saturated malts; a slight roasted quality.  Predominently chocolate malt on the palette; some smoke and layered milk chocolate.  Medium finish.
Poured out jet black(hence the name) with a small light brownish head.Flavor is of coffee and malt and licorice.Very good schwarzbier.
Bottle at Bishop Arms, Gothenburg. Brown/black colour with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted, caramel, hop, malt. Flavour is roasted, malt, hop, sweet, apple,coffee.
pours full with decent head.  The taste is has hints of liquorice, coffee, and burnt wood.  Very drinkable and relatively cheap.     One of my favs.

[bottle from Galerie Pivni]
Almost smokey aroma of delicate roast and a touch of noble hops.  Pours an opaque black thats orangish brown in the thinnest parts with floating wisps of tan.  Molasses malt and floral, noble hops mingle in a sweetish, roasty grog.  Almost not enough bitterness to balance the residual sweetness.  This is a BIG 5.2% abv beer.  Medium to full body with low carbonation and a barely not clean finish of bitter dark malt.
[Bottled at Stockholm Beer Festival] Very dark brown, minimal nose. Bready nose. Very sweet with some creamy roasty malt, ink and clean mouthfeel. Fairly light bodied. Low bitterness.

Bottled at Bishops Arms, Gothenburg. Almost black, clear-looking beer with a small beige head. Roasted flavor and aroma with chocolate and coffee. A bit thin body, and a dryish, coffee-bitter finish. I like it! (060825)

12 oz bottle via Malt of The earth beer club. Pours a dark brown/near black color with a large tan head. Very nice fruity aroma with notes of vanilla, toffee, mocha and caramel. Flavors of toffee, cheery, pear, and a somewhat bitter orange hoppy finish and aftertaste. Soft carbonation almost like a creamy nitro beer. Sort of a cross between a bock and a porter? Pretty good beer.

Bottle. Black red/ brown color, huge beautiful beige head. The aroma is quite sweet with notes of caramel, but also some roasted malt and straw. The flavor is also quite sweet with strong notes of caramel and roasted malt - almost burnt malt, the end is dry from the roastyness and somewhat bitter from the hops.

The aroma is like cane sugar and coffee with toasted malt and oak. There is also a hint of rum. The appearance is black with a small head. The flavor is exactly like the aroma minus the rum. The palate is smooth but thin. The aftertaste is bitter. This is a good beer but overrated.

Pours a very dark thick black with a small brown head. Aroma of coffee and some sweet molasses.  The mouthful is very very thick for the abv. Coats the mouth with a delicious smooth coffee taste. The balance is amazing, as is the uniqueness of this beer. Smooth and fantastic.

dark, roasty, chocolate, coffee, malt aroma.  a very good looking beer that is almost opaque black with a medium sized brown head.  flavor is roasty and chocolatey while keeping its lagering properties(lighter body).  leaves a long chocolate aftertaste.  a real good one!

Tasted 25/08/2006. 500ml bottle from Rumbles, Wellington.
Deep dark chestnut, near black, with a very light tan tinge to the head.  Head droops but lingers and laces. Roasty malts on the nose hint at coffee, wood, rum and mollasses. Good underlying base of malt sweetness, in the mouth, with a woody, roasty backbone and a slight hop spice. Hops are slightly fruity on the palate and alcohol is warming in the finish. Silky smooth: softly carbonated and a lovely fullish weight. Fantastic schwarzbier.

Black body, huge beautiful beige head; Pleasant, balanced nose of malt and hop; Soft textured body, a little flat, a little watery and bitter, again balanced; Finishes quite long and pleasantly bitter, complex aromas of licorice, cacao bean and lemon.
Tried as a comparison to Moa Noir.  Quite liked it but a bit watery and not much head.  It cost nz$6.50 at Rumbles in Wellington.  The Moa Noir was more complex.

Bohemian blaq lager is where its at. Better than a lot of porters and stouts Ive had, even if its a bit watery. Balance is placed well in this black gold. Smoked malts mixed in a deep batch of not too bitter, not too milky chocolate. Slight caramel presence, some back cherry/berry and licorice flavour comes forth on the hop train. Well done. Id love to stock this.

Very good...almost black (as the name suggests).  I had this up in the Blue Ridge Mountains of North Carolina in bottle.  The wine shop highly recommended it.  A little bit of a Stout-like flavor.  Smoky, but very drinkable.  Not much head on the pour from the bottle.  Excellent beer...tasty, easy to drink, and very well made.

Deep black with some light tan head that receded quickly to a ring. Nose is lots of caramel, the Saaz of course, and some toffee. Flavor is awesome. Good caramel malts, very meaty mixed well with the hops. Has some roast notes and a bit of chocolate. Love the hoppiness. A bit of an earthy aftertaste, especially as it warmed. Medium bodied, very smooth and crisp. Ive said it one, and Ill say it again, I love me my European Schwarzs.

Bottle.  Ruby, brown-so-dark-its-black beer with a very dark brown, creamy head.  Roasted malt aroma with dark chocolate and caramel.  Very very dark, roasty toasty taste, completed by medium bitterness from the hops.  Complementary sweetness around the edges.  Full-bodied and smooth with some tickling of the tongue.  Earthy, chewy, a warriors drink indeed!  Notes of red berry. Very dry finish.  Delightful - big thanks to pivnizub!

Dark brown color. The aroma is nice, with delicate roasted malt. Medium body strength, somehow dry; roasted malt and ashes; not too complex but pleasant and well brewed, most of all the final, with roasted malt, light liquorice, caramel, Fernet Branca herbs.Good to drink it during this Midsummer day with Swedish fish; in the big Cardinal mug I even think it tastes like some old Swiss dunkel ;-)

A Mes rate: 
50cl bottle from the glorious Wine of Course in Highgate. Ok, after a rauchbier this is probably not the best time to rate something new but here it is anyway. Pretty decent stuff. Never ordered one of these due to the name (Sim bought it) but it is jolly good. Smokey almost porter type stuff. Chocolate and malty all round. Pretty straight forward but enjoyable all the same. Hints of caramel in the nose. Butter in the flavour. Black body, poor head. Yup its not bad at all.

Poured a dark black brownish color with a nice initial head. The lacing was weak, but the head sustained itself quite nicely. The aroma was of coffee first and foremost, followed by some chocolate, some roastedness, and very light licorice. The flavor was much of the same with some caramel, and as it warmed it really came on nicely. The mouthfeel started too thin, but got respectable after warming.

This is a totally sweet beer, literally and figuratively.  You can almost taste the castle cellar used to age this beer for 500 years.  Though I am not very familiar with the Schwarzbier, this is my favorite one... ever.

Bottle. Reddish black color with fading tan head. Strong good maltiness in the aroma, with soft roastiness, salty licorice, toffee, some sweetness and some fruitiness. Reminds the aroma of beer poured on the hot stones of sauna. The flavor is dryer than aroma with roastedness (charred), firm bitterness, dark fruits, toffee and saaz hops. Very  clean and firm flavor. Dry roasted finish. My favourite schwarzbier!

(Bottle BB 30/12/06) Aroma of caramel, roasted malt, coffee and light hoppy. Black colour and light brown, average size, quickly almost fully diminishing head with fair lacing. Black with a large brown head, fine lacings. Aroma moderate malty (burnt, smoky) and hoppy. Flavor moderate sweet and bitter. Light to medium body, oily, soft carbonated. Smooth as velvet.

A very dark red-brown beer with a nice bubbly brown head. The aroma is quite sweet with primary notes of caramel, but also some roasted malt and straw. The flavor is also quite sweet with strong notes of caramel and roasted malt - almost burnt malt, the end is dry from the roastyness and somewhat bitter from the hops. A very crisp beer. The mouthfeel is very smooth.

Bottled. Very dark brown, close to black colour, mediumsized brown head. Roasted malts and coffee in aroma with caramel coming in a bit weaker. Strong roasted malts and espresso coffee in flavour. Hops comes in aftertaste, along with roast. Extremely wellbalanced and excellent mouthfeel. I think I just got myself a new favourite Czech beer!

Medium body with accents of lightly burned malt. But otherwise this is an extremely complex, vinous - as in port wine - brew with some underlying sweetness. Some coffee returns in the finish. My bottle was 8 months past its best before date, but it really has aged gracefully. 130406

Bottle. Sable pour with garnet highlights and a brown fizzy head. Actually sounded like soda during the pour. Pungent roasty chocolate malt nose. Bold, lively mouthfeel, nice chocolatey flavor with sweet cocoa and malty notes. The hops really comethrough in the finish, a bitter mocha. Loved it!

black and more black with a creamy off white head that vanishes quite quickly, aroma of coffee and malt, not sure of this should be described more as a porter than a lager even though it has had the 70 days maturing. very smooth and an excellent long nutty finish, excellent

Really good. Nice sweetness in the smell and a nice off-white head. Taste is sweet with a liqurice feel, quite roasted  and a bit nutty. Like a fresh porter. Recommended.

Bottle.  Definitely red-tinged black like a classic demon.  Nice swiss cheese tan head.  Full flavored like a porter, almost.  Still, light-ish palate and drinkable.  Faintly sweet, and plenty bitter.  Coffee roast malts.  Still, a bit lagery (ie, that cornmetal lager yeast flavor is slightly there, noticing the more you drink it) and not great feeling from mouth to head (ie, got a ver minor stomachache and headache that I only get from lagers and not ales, probably because of the carbonation).

Thanks a lot to pivnizub for this gem!!! Das ist a ein wunderbares Paket, welches Du da zusammengestellt hast - freue mich riesig und schicke bald selbiges - da perfekt für den postalischen Versand - mit neuen Bieren für Dich zurück! Ok - about the beer: Nice pitch black color with a big light brown frothy head. Medium intense charcoal, chocolate and lots of toasted malt in the nose. Actually a nice smooth taste - some coal, roasted malt, a bit tabacco in the finish - lovely long lasting aftertaste.
a favorite among friends.  dark brown with beige head.  toffee aroma with a hint of chocolate.  medium bodied, creamy.

1. Cask Handpump at the Penny Black, Northwich (JDW) 26/04/2001
Woody aroma. Chocolate flavour and alcohol in the finish.
2. Cask Handpump at the Penny Black, Northwich 25/02/2005
Dark red coloured and sweet on the palate. Dry slight roast finish.

"Poured a dark brown with an okay head, lacin wasnt great. Aroma was of coffee lots of coffee and some roastedness. Flavor was the same with some carmel malts in it. Mouthfeel was thin for most of the beer, but got better as it warmed."

Poured from bottle into a dimpled mug.  Has a nearly black color with hints of ruby at the edges of the mug.  It developed a light brown head that was short-lived.  I noticed some toastiness and molasses initially in the nosing, and soon afterwards I got some mild noble hops.  In the flavor I noticed some nice smokiness that I didnt catch in the aroma.  A very smooth and easy drinker!

In the 0.5L bottle from New Pioneer Co-Op in Iowa City. Pours black with a light brown head. Medium carbonation. Excellent roasted coffee aroma. Good thick palate. Chocolate and smoke flavor. Pretty sweet- almost candy-like. Quite good and quite a bargain at $1.99 a bottle.
Very dark red brown with a small off-white head. Smokey roasted malt aroma with dark chocolate. The taste was creamy, smooth, with dark malt, liquorice and a slight bitterness.

Poured a dark mahogney with a big off-white head. Roasty malt aroma with some dark fruits (maybe prunes). Flavor was just great, roasted malts, a slight burnt caramel flavor with a hint of smoke. A very smooth drinking beer WOW.
Very dark red in color. Faint burnt scent. Clear burnt taste, some iron like flavour. A nice Schwartzbier.

500 ml bottle from DiCarlos/Armanettis in Mundelein, IL (Dec 2005).  Cellar temperature, served in a Zwiec lager glass.  Pours a translucent cola-black with big fluffy slow-diminishing tan cap....huge aroma of prunes, root beer, almonds and dark roasty malt, absolutely luscious....on the tongue, very very sweet at first, chocolaty-grapy, with darker chocolate and roasty character emerging slowly in the velvety, pillowy liquid...the mouthfeel is very milky-creamy, like a thin chocolate shake, with a rather low carbonation level that really works surprisingly well given how sweet this sucker is, never cloying....towards the finish a light herbal bitterness shows up and the modest saaz hopping becomes apparent.  A final, dark harvest of grain and subtle hops before the winter begins...transcendent.

Czechs for centuries, have brewed dark lagers, the most famous coming from a 15th Century brewpub in Prague called U-Fleku. Herold Bohemian Black Lager comes out of that Czech dark lager traditon, and is a delicious, smooth, complex dark lager, very similar to German schwarzbier or "black beer". 

This beer is brewed with four different malts including pilsner, crystal, Munich, and black patent. It employs the decoction method of brewing, in which a portion of the mash is removed from the mash tun, heated to a higher temperature, and then returned to the mash. This step in the brewing process gives a beer deep, toasty, and nutty malt character. Herold Bohemian Black is an exceptionally smooth beer, being lagered from 75 to 80 days. This beer is hopped three times with one variety, the famous Bohemian Red, or Saaz hop. 

Herold Bohemian Black Lager pours to a deep brown/black color with a thick and creamy white head, and a soft carbonation. The nose on this beer is very complex with aromas of sweet malt, nuts, dark chocolate, a hint of roast, a touch of smoke, and grassy hop aromas. The palate is equally complex with a slick and clean mouth feel. Flavors of dark chocolate, sweet malt, nuts, toast, with slight hints of roast and smoke that coat the tongue. This beer is very smooth and drinkable, and weighs in at 5.2% abv. Bohemian Black finishes with more complex dark malt flavors up front, and ends with a slighty grassy/cedary hop bitterness, that balances this beer to perfection. 

This is an outstanding dark lager with tremendous flavor and character. The label states this beer is a schwarzbier, and indeed it is. However, it is a little different from German examples. Herold Bohemian Black is a bit richer and fuller on the palate than its German counterparts, and a bit more hoppy in aroma and bitterness. This beer would work well with a number of hearty dishes. I would match this with German fare, Barbecued or grilled meats, even Japanese cuisine. Herold Bohemian Black is available in 1/2 liter bottles, and retails for $1.98 a bottle, making it well worth seeking out. A beer of this quality, at that price, is a steal.
(Bottle)  Poursa dark mahogany body with a large off-white head and good lacing.  Aroma of roasted malt, molasses, and cocoa.  Falvor of roasted malt with a hint of dark fruit in the finish.

Brown/black liquid supports a foamy, collapsing light tan head. Faint roasted malt aroma, perhaps a little smokiness as well. Medium full mouthfeel with a richness and smoothness that surprises. The flavor is not as sweet as one might expect, but its certainly not bitter. Nice balance of burnt caramel, faint smoke, and roasted malts. A very slight bitterness at the end is more due to the dark roasted malts than hops I suspect. Actually, the complexity surprised me. Quite enjoyable and easy to drink. A good beer to introduce to people who claim that they dont like "dark beer."

(500 ml bottle: Obtained in trade with whaleman, thanks David!) This shows a bit more complexity than the dark, black lagers Ive tried so far.  Like many of the others, theres the sweet and roasty maltiness, the fine smokiness in the midpalate and finish, the moderate molasses and brown sugar, and light bitterness with a bit of hops in the finish, but Im also getting a fair amount of earth and wood, plus some maple and even a hint of cherry too.  Lots of brown sugar and molasses in the nose, but less roast and smoke than in the flavor.  The body comes across as a bit thin to me, but the real problem is the carbonation levels are fairly low.  Accordingly, the light tan head is very small and filmy on the pour and fully dissipates within a few minutes.  The body is very dark brown with ruddy highlights on the edges.  It seems to have good clarity, but its dark enough that I still cant really see through the beer.  In the end, the beer is quite sweet and shows a lot of sugary sweetness to boot, but despite this, the added complexity is a pleasant surprise and the overall impression is a very positive one.

Deep dark black with thin moka head. Sweet smokey malt with  a bit of pumpkin spices in aroma. In mouth, roasted coffee with smoked notes, peaty in character, rich and interesting, veering on Rauschbeer style. Nice. Baugth at Sams Wine, Chicago. 1.99$

This brew is rare example of "old world" quality.  The dark malt protects both the aroma and flavor from oxidation.  The aroma is that of soft, aromatic hops.  The most expensive type.  The taste is delicate and robust at the same time.  This is due to the malt, decotion mashing, soft water and long (by western standards) lager time.  An exceptional value and almost always "fresh" tasting.

Bottle. Almost black colour with a big baige head. Light roasted, coffee, dark fruits aroma and a sweet light roasted, coffee, licorice, dark fruits taste. Medium body with a sweet finish. Plesant beer.

Metallic finish.

What a treat (particularly since it was supplied by a non beer drinking friend).  Poured dark walnut brown to black.  Hints of garnet at the edges. Fairly full bodied, lots of crunchy malt and a well balanced spicy bitterness, finish is long and full flavoured.This is an unusual, complex, but surprisingly clean and refreshing brew.

Bottled at Bishops Arms, Helsingborg. Dark reddish brown coloured. Malty caramel aroma with notes of chocolate. Sweet and malty flavour with roasty notes. Soft and pleasant.
Very dark amber, nice brownish head. Aroma is malty and brings figs, toffe, cream and some grapes. Quite mild flavor, malty but also a bit metallic.

Sweetbitter flavour, medium body, smooth carbonation and mouthfeel. Strong roastmalty taste that lingers into the finish with bitter chocolate, coffee and liquorice, dry and lasting hopbitter finish. Complex, excellent and perfectly rounded Schwarzbier.

Deep and dark with ruby highlights under a tall head of tan that fell quickly.
